alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:04PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Routt and northeastern Moffat Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Baggs to 6 miles north of Hayden to 9 miles southwest of Oak Creek. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Steamboat Springs, Hayden, Oak Creek, Yampa, Clark, Milner, Tow Creek, Slater and Phippsburg. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 105 and 146. Colorado 13 between mile markers 110 and 128. Colorado 131 between mile markers 43 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin
